timeline.message: Detect env var change during MII re-instrospect (MD5 check).

timeline.bodyText: Is the name of the environment variable alone sufficient, no need to have the value?
timeline.author: jshum2479

replies.bodyText: Yes, the name alone is sufficient.  The 'modelInImage.sh' MD5 check iterates over the names and gets the values directly from the env vars.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

timeline.bodyText: I think Tom added that for a reason. At one point in early stage of MII,  I use it for dynamic update - i.e. the job pod will use wlst online to update configuration.  That's one reason I can think of.  util.sh also has a function using it.

timeline.bodyText: The method name implies that it is only matching the name, but it is actually matching the name and value. It should be named in a way that makes it clear what is happening. Simple "envVar" would probably be a more readable choice.

timeline.bodyText: So this is the name of an environment variable whose value is a comma-separated list of environment variable names? That's far from obvious. At the very least, please include a Javadoc comment explaining that.
timeline.author: russgold

timeline.bodyText:
"hasEnvVarContains" is a confusing name. It is not checking to see if it has a "envVarContains," but rather whether the special env var OSEV includes the specified name in a list, correct? I had to do a fair amount of searching through the code even to come up with that suggestion.
I would suggest then, that the actual test needs to be explicit. That is, fetch the envVar and check its contents. Among other things, you are testing that this envVar does not contain an entry for the admin user and password, but the matcher not(hasEnvVarContains(OSEV, "ADMIN_PASSWORD")) could easily be satisfied if there is no envVar whose name matches OSEV.
To make it easier to read, I would suggest an assertion such as:
assertThat(getOSEVValues(), allOf(hasItem(configMapKeyRefEnvVar.getName()), etc.
where getOSEVValues() returns a (possibly empty) list of the names in the OSEV variable.
